author: Staff Reporter
text:
Residents of Adyar wanted the rusted and abandoned street lamp posts on pavements in Indira Nagar removed immediately.

Not only have the lamp posts completely taken away the pavement space, but they also pose a serious risk to pedestrians’ safety, residents complained. The posts have been dumped outside the office of Junior Engineer on First Avenue.

“The posts have been lying there for a long time and we are unable to complain as the engineer’s office is locked,” said R. Gopal, a resident. The office premises is dumped with wires, street junction boxes, and domestic meters. “There is a complete breakdown of law and order around this area. Pedestrians, especially senior citizens face the risk of being run over by the speeding vehicles on the road. After sunset, the area around the office becomes a den for miscreants,” complained S. Narayanan, another resident. Corporation officials said they will remove the abandoned and rusted pavements at the earliest and also take steps to ensure that the office of junior engineer becomes functional again.
title: ‘Remove abandoned lamp posts from pavements’
